title.native: 「C」 THE MONEY OF SOUL AND POSSIBILITY CONTROL
title.romaji: C: THE MONEY OF SOUL AND POSSIBILITY CONTROL
title.english: [C] - CONTROL - The Money and Soul of Possibility

description:
The Japanese government was rescued from the brink of financial collapse by the Sovereign Wealth Fund. For its citizens, however, life has not improved and unemployment, crime, suicide, and despair are rampant. Kimimaro, raised by his maternal aunt after the disappearance of his father and the death of his mother, is a scholarship student whose only dream is to live a stable, ordinary life. One day he meets a man who offers him a large sum of money if he will allow his "future" to be held as collateral. From then on his fate is radically altered as he's drawn into a mysterious realm known as the Financial District, where he must compete in weekly tournaments called "deals" in order to keep his money and avoid losing his future.

(Source: Wikipedia)
synonyms: [C] The Money of Soul and Possibility Control
The Money of Souland Possibility Controul

name.native: ジェニファー・サトウ

node.description:
**[Profile (Office Without)](http://www.officewithout.com/iwasaki.html)** | **[Twitter](https://twitter.com/taque68)** | **[MySpace](https://myspace.com/taqueiwasaki)** | **[Blog (JP)](https://ameblo.jp/soundtrack-maker)**

A composer and musician generally known for his jazz-like scores.

When he was 3 years old he was given a piano, he was also taken to Yamaha Music School, where he first came into contact with music. He quit music school as an elementary school student and, until his high school years, studied under Iwashita Tetsuya, who taught him how to use multiple recordings and synthesizers. He became a composer in his later high school years, through the various efforts made by himself and his teacher.

In 1985, he won a prize at the Kanagawa Arts Festival choral composition competition, while in the late 1980s, after entering Tokyo University of the Arts, he studied contemporary music under Satou Shin and Aoshima Hiroshi. While still being a student, he received the New Artist Award from the Japan Contemporary Music Association. He later started working as an arranger after graduating from college.

In 1999, he participated in the music unit "Smart Drug" with Koizumi Hiroshi, who was responsible for doing the composition and playing the guitar, and Okamoto Sayori who would later rename to Hiyoko, who was responsible for doing the lyrics and vocals. He participated under the alias "Taque," where he was responsible for the arrangement and playing the keyboard. They released three CDs from 1999 to 2002.

(Source: Wikipedia)

The founder and former representative director of [Funimation](https://anilist.co/studio/102/).

**Non-anime roles:**
- Policeman in "Chuck E. Cheese in the Galaxy 5000"
Freelance. Close friends with [Takahiro Kishida](https://anilist.co/staff/101403/).

Freelance director originating from [Toei Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/18/).

Known for having directed shows such as [Mononoke](https://anilist.co/anime/2246/), [Welcome to Irabu's Office](https://anilist.co/anime/6774/) and [Tsuritama](https://anilist.co/anime/12883/) among others. He was also set to serve as an assistant director to [Mamoru Hosoda](https://anilist.co/staff/100067/) on [Howl's Moving Castle](https://anilist.co/anime/431/), but this was later scrapped due to creative differences with [Hayao Miyazaki](https://anilist.co/staff/96870/), who ended up directing the film himself.

Freelance director originating from [Toei Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/18/).

Known for having directed shows such as [Mononoke](https://anilist.co/anime/2246/), [Welcome to Irabu's Office](https://anilist.co/anime/6774/) and [Tsuritama](https://anilist.co/anime/12883/) among others. He was also set to serve as an assistant director to [Mamoru Hosoda](https://anilist.co/staff/100067/) on [Howl's Moving Castle](https://anilist.co/anime/431/), but this was later scrapped due to creative differences with [Hayao Miyazaki](https://anilist.co/staff/96870/), who ended up directing the film himself.

Freelance director originating from [Toei Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/18/).

Known for having directed shows such as [Mononoke](https://anilist.co/anime/2246/), [Welcome to Irabu's Office](https://anilist.co/anime/6774/) and [Tsuritama](https://anilist.co/anime/12883/) among others. He was also set to serve as an assistant director to [Mamoru Hosoda](https://anilist.co/staff/100067/) on [Howl's Moving Castle](https://anilist.co/anime/431/), but this was later scrapped due to creative differences with [Hayao Miyazaki](https://anilist.co/staff/96870/), who ended up directing the film himself.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/235154812) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/en/users/30949)

Started out as amateur gif animator before turning professional. He initially failed an examination test for [Gainax](https://anilist.co/studio/6/) but was later scouted by the late [Osamu Kobayashi](https://anilist.co/staff/100406/) for [Beck](https://anilist.co/anime/57/). There he met noted animators [Norio Matsumoto](https://anilist.co/staff/100991/) and [Satoru Utsunomiya](https://anilist.co/staff/101489/), the former which he would work with on numerous occasions afterwards.

His breakthrough as an animator was on [Noein](https://anilist.co/anime/584/), a series directed by [Kazuki Akane](https://anilist.co/staff/102416/). The 12th episode was highly regarded by animation fans and other animators for the given display by him and Matsumoto. He would later also serve as a character designer on [Birdy the Mighty: Decode](https://anilist.co/anime/3974/), another series directed by Akane.

His dedication for animation could also be seen on [The Girl Who Leapt Through Time](https://anilist.co/anime/2236/), for which he animated a minute-long scene of the main character running down a street. He went on the actual street in Tokyo to film himself for reference footage for the cut.

name.native: スクール フード パニッシュメント

node.description: Introduction: School Food Punishment was a Japanese four-piece rock/pop/electronica band. They were first signed under record label July Records/United Asia Entertainment (2007-2007), then under Fiveman Army Rocks (2008-2009) and then finally signed under Sony Music Japan's Epic Records Japan prior to their breakup in June 2012. The lyrics of each of the band's songs from 2004-2012 were written by lead vocalist and guitarist Yumi Uchimura. Biography: The band was founded on October 2004 by [Uchimura Yumi](https://anilist.co/staff/152896/), while their first live performance took place in December the same year. In 2007, their debut album, "school food is good food", was released. In 2008, both of their songs, "feedback" and "Futari Umi no Soko" were featured as theme songs to the Japanese television drama Joshidaisei Kaikeishi no Jikenbo, while their mini-album "Riff-rain" was released by Tower Records and sold out in under a week. They also performed in numerous live concerts, including FM802, part of the Minami Wheel 2008 live event, and the J-Wave Live event, part of the Tokyo Real Eyes Live Supernova. In 2009, they signed onto their first major record label, Sony Music Japan's Epic Records Japan division. Their major label debut was the song "futuristic imagination", which was used as the ending theme song to the Kenji Kamiyama directed anime television series Eden of the East, airing on the highly rated noitaminA timeslot on Fuji TV. Among their first projects, was contributing to Judy and Mary's 15th Anniversary Tribute Album, in which they covered the band's "Brand New Wave Upper Ground" song, with their performance praised by sources such as The Japan Times for having been the highlight of the album, and for having evoked Judy and Mary's songwriting and musical values. In 2012, the band announced that it would be going on an indefinite hiatus. The band said the decision came as a result of discussions between the four members. On June 11, 2012 the band announced that they had broken up due to vocalist [Uchimura Yumi](https://anilist.co/staff/152896/) having left the band. Following the disbandment of the band School Food Punishment, [Uchimura Yumi](https://anilist.co/staff/152896/), producer [Eguchi Ryo](https://anilist.co/staff/109383/) and touring guitarist Mitsui Ritsuo joined the band la la larks known as the successor to the band School Food Punishment. In 2016, Hasuo Masayuki and Yamasaki Hideaki found a new singer named Annabel, and formed their own band siraph, as well. Final Members: - [Uchimura Yumi](https://anilist.co/staff/152896/) (内村友美) – founder, lead-vocalist, guiarist and songwriter (2004-2012) - Hasuo Masayuki (蓮尾理之) – keyboardist, organist, electric pianoist and composer (2004-2012) - Hideaki Yamasaki (山崎英明) – bass guitarist, backing vocalist and composer (2008-2012) - Hidai Osamu (比田井修) – drummer and composer (2007-2012) Former Members: - Ueda Atsushi (上田睦) – bass guitarist (2004-2008) - Katano Katsuya (片野勝哉) – drummer (2004-2007) (Source: en.wikipedia.org)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/sushio_) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/sushiogumicompany/) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E3%81%99%E3%81%97%E3%81%8A)

Ishizaki Toshio, better known as Sushio, is an animator, illustrator and character designer working for [Trigger](https://anilist.co/studio/803/).

After graduating from Yoyogi Animation Academy, he joined [Gainax](https://anilist.co/studio/6/). He debuted as an in-betweener in [Neon Genesis Evangelion](https://anilist.co/anime/30/), as a key animator on [Berserk](https://anilist.co/anime/33/), and as an animation director on [Mahoromatic](https://anilist.co/anime/276/). In 2007, he served as a character designer for the first time on [Kiss Dum: Engage Planet](https://anilist.co/anime/2106/). He was a key staff member at Gainax for a long time, but left in 2011 when [Hiroyuki Imaishi](https://anilist.co/staff/97349/) and others established the anime production company Trigger. There he was given the job of handling the character designs for [Kill la Kill](https://anilist.co/anime/18679/), the first TV series produced by the newly-found studio.

Specializes in action and effects, and his skills attract a lot of attention in the industry.

Took part as a key animator on Quentin Tarantino's "Kill Bill: Vol. 1" in 2003.

(Source: Wikipedia)

name.native: ニコタッチズザウォールズ

node.description:
__Members:__
Tatsuya Mitsumura - vocals and guitar 
Daisuke Furumura - guitar
Shingo Sakakura - bass
Shotaro Tsushima - drums

A Japanese rock band that formed in 2004. The group made their major debut with the mini album "How Are You?" in November 2007, and they held their first concert at Tokyo's Nippon Budokan complex in March 2010.

A Japanese rock band that formed in 2004. The group made their major debut with the mini album "How Are You?" in November 2007, and they held their first concert at Tokyo's Nippon Budokan complex in March 2010.

__Real Name:__ Yuusuke Hiroshima (広島 祐介)

[Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/member.php?id=43614)

__[Website](https://www.lotusjuice.com/)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/lotusjuice)__ | __[Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/groups/lotusjuicefanclub/)__ | __[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/lotusjuice/)__

__Biography:__
 Lotus Juice, otherwise nicknamed アニキ (Aniki) is a Japanese rapper, known to be one of the pioneers in rap for official Japanese anime and game music. His rap music consists of 90's Hip Hop, J-Pop, Dub, Rock, Comedy, Love and many more. He is well known for his works with Shoji Meguro from ATLUS Japan, ripping the mic on the track "Mass Destruction" in the game Persona 3. 

He has been traveling around the world from Argentina, Mexico, to USA performing at anime and game conventions in front of his international fans. His unique flow has caught attention from [Taku Iwasaki](https://anilist.co/staff/100172/Taku-Iwasaki), and their collaboration has gained substantial recognition.

(Source: [Lotus Juice's Official Website](https://www.lotusjuice.com/profile-english/))

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/tuka_trg)

After graduating from the Department of Art at Osaka University of Arts he joined Studio Ghibli as photographer and later transferred to Gainax, where he made his debut as director on some episodes of Evangelion.
    
He left Gainax in 2011 to found [Studio Trigger](https://anilist.co/studio/803/Trigger) together with [Hiroyuki Imaishi](https://anilist.co/staff/97349/Hiroyuki-Imaishi) and [Kazuya Masumoto](https://anilist.co/staff/150019/Kazuya-Masumoto). He is currently the CEO of the company.

Twitter __Ryou Eguchi__ is a Japanese producer, composer and arranger. He was the producer of the Japanese rock-band School Food Punishment between 2008 until 2012 when the band officially disbanded. He later joined la la larks, with previous members from the band School Food Punishment as their producer.

Twitter __Ryou Eguchi__ is a Japanese producer, composer and arranger. He was the producer of the Japanese rock-band School Food Punishment between 2008 until 2012 when the band officially disbanded. He later joined la la larks, with previous members from the band School Food Punishment as their producer.

Twitter __Ryou Eguchi__ is a Japanese producer, composer and arranger. He was the producer of the Japanese rock-band School Food Punishment between 2008 until 2012 when the band officially disbanded. He later joined la la larks, with previous members from the band School Food Punishment as their producer.

**Birthplace:** Towada, Aomori Prefecture, Japan

__Biography:__
Junji Ishiwatari is a guitarist, lyricist and music producer. He was the guitarist of the rock band SUPERCAR, until they broke up in 2005. 

Ishiwatari has worked wtih [Chatmonchy](https://anilist.co/staff/105025), [9mm Parabellum Bullet](https://anilist.co/staff/126805), [Negoto](https://anilist.co/staff/148616), [NICO Touches the Walls](https://anilist.co/staff/103965), etc.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/suzumevachi)

Freelancer formerly affiliated with [Toei Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/18/).

Close friends with [Rie Matsumoto](https://anilist.co/staff/107664/), and the two often work together.
